channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Park Lane steps reopen in Belvedere after concrete replacement project
item.description: Belvedere completes $113,000 Park Lane staircase, but residents criticize concrete bench's "brutalist" design.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Belvedere's Sal Bonavita was one of the earliest owners of Peetâ€™s Coffee
item.description: Sal Bonavita, Alfred Peet's hand-picked successor who owned Peet's Coffee in the 1980s, died at 84 in Belvedere.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Belvedere-Tiburon Landmarks Society seeks $50k for repairs at historic sites
item.description: Belvedere-Tiburon Landmarks Society seeks $50,000 to restore historic sites with anonymous donor matching gifts.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A visiting artist tries to be mindful as can be
item.description: El Cerrito artist Jim Vecchi visits Tiburon by chance, sharing how his MS diagnosis inspired an 8-year video project.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Pick of the Week: Bee Gees tribute closes out Belvedere park concert series
item.description: Bee Gees tribute band You Should Be Dancing closes Belvedere's free park concert series Aug. 31 at 4 p.m.
item.dc:creator: The Ark

item.title: Town Hall hosts wildlife photography and Cedars art exhibitions
item.description: Two art exhibitions open at Tiburon Town Hall featuring wildlife photography and work by artists with developmental disabilities.
item.dc:creator: Diane Smith

item.title: Belvedere-Tiburon Library will commemorate 30 years of independence
item.description: The Belvedere-Tiburon Library marks 30 years of independence from county control with celebration events Sept. 5 and 7.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Tiburon girls tackle new territory with flag football
item.description: Two Tiburon girls turn yearlong campaign into reality, launching Redwood's first girls' varsity flag football team with 30 players.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister
